result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Lee Sager was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Christopher Lee Sager appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared by video for Christopher Lee Sager. Calling 21CF268, 22CF12, 21TR1955, 21TR1956 & 21TR1957. Van Ells states has filed consent to consolidate Forest County case 20CF71. Van Ells statement to agreement. State moves to Dismiss 21TR1955, 21TR1956 & 21TR1957. Granted. State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 3, 4, 5 & 7. Granted. Court allows consolidation. Parties request PSI. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Court orders PSI due by April 11, 2022 - author need not be present. Van Ells statement to bond. Bonds are revoked. adj. 01:58 PM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Van Ells willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 08:42
